node.title: Transcript: Dr. Anthony Fauci on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Anthony Fauci, chief medical adviser to President Biden, airing on Sunday, November 28, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: The W.H.O. skips forward two Greek letters, avoiding a Xi variant.
node.description: Under the World Health Organization’s system, the Omicron variant might have been called Nu or Xi, but only at the risk of ambiguity or diplomatic awkwardness.

node.title: Fox Hosts Suggest COVID Variants Are Being Made up by Democrats
node.description: Amid growing alarm about the Omicron variant, the hosts of Fox & Friends claimed new variants are being used to help Democrats.

node.title: For Ku Stevens, Running Is a ‘Profound Act’
node.description: This fall, Ku Stevens became the fastest cross-country runner in all of Nevada. But he would be running even if he wasn’t winning.

node.title: Jim Acosta Slams Kevin McCarthy for Not Standing up to GOP 'Freak Show Caucus'
node.description: "In the freak show caucus, loyalty only flows in one direction… which means more hatred, more bigotry, more glorification of violence, and more appeasement," Acosta said.

node.title: The Storyteller of Design Miami
node.description: Wava Carpenter was the fair’s first employee 15 years ago, and now she’s overseeing the content of the December edition with a theme of “Human Kind.”

node.title: A Curator Makes Room for Big Ideas and Big Art
node.description: The Mexico City curator Magalí Arriola will again assemble Meridians at Art Basel Miami Beach, a diverting lineup of hard-to-fit pieces.

node.title: In Opposite Styles, 2 African Artists Capture the Same Spirit
node.description: Marcellina Akpojotor, of Nigeria, and Sungi Mlengeya, of Tanzania, explore female empowerment and the roles of women in African society.

node.title: If You Linger in the Palm Beach Area and Boca Raton
node.description: They are packed with restaurants, stunning hotels and spectacular views.

node.title: Florida Museums Highlight Frida Kahlo, Diego Rivera and Machu Picchu
node.description: Museums in West Palm Beach and Boca Raton present exhibitions of the Mexican artists and of Peruvian ceramics and gold and silver ornaments.

node.title: An Artist Once Reborn Is Now Rediscovered
node.description: Maryan, who reinvented himself after surviving Nazi death camps, comes into contemporary focus in a retrospective in North Miami.

node.title: Translating Culture Through the Faces of Qatar
node.description: The artist Mubarak al-Malik is bringing a signature object — the traditional batoola face covering — to Miami in a mural that he hopes will show off his homeland.

node.title: For 2 Bogotá Galleries, Art Basel Means Business
node.description: With a limited market in Colombia, Casas Riegner and Instituto de Visión depend on art fairs to survive and to support the careers of their artists.

node.title: An Art Fair Meets a Pent-Up Demand
node.description: This year’s edition of Art Basel Miami Beach brings collectors back while welcoming a more diverse group of gallery owners.

node.title: Weaving the Threads of Applied and Contemporary Art
node.description: Works created with or inspired by textiles and crafting are being showcased at Art Basel Miami Beach and at satellite fairs.

node.title: Local News Outlets Could Reap $1.7 Billion in Build Back Better Aid
node.description: A small paper like The Storm Lake Times in Iowa would receive a big tax credit. So would Gannett, the nation’s largest news publisher.

node.title: Years of Delays, Billions in Overruns: The Dismal History of Big Infrastructure
node.description: The nation’s most ambitious engineering projects are mired in postponements and skyrocketing costs. Delivering $1.2 trillion in new infrastructure will be tough.

node.title: What’s at Stake in the Honduran Presidential Election?
node.description: Hondurans head to the polls on Sunday, but widespread political violence during the campaign and questionable results from 2017 are looming large.

node.title: ‘You’re Not Helpless’: For London Women, Learning to Fight Builds Confidence
node.description: After a year marked by isolation, loneliness and violence in the city, many self-defense and martial arts gyms say they are seeing more interest from women.

node.title: Intelligence Analysts 'Didn't Understand Donald Trump, How Far He Would Go'
node.description: In this daily series, Newsweek explores the steps that led to the January 6 Capitol Riot.

node.title: Powerball Results, Numbers for 11/27/21: Did Anyone Win the $243M Jackpot?
node.description: The Powerball numbers on Saturday were 8, 32, 55, 64 and 66. The Powerball was 10 and the Power Play was 2X.

node.title: Woman in custody after fire at Cairns Covid-19 quarantine hotel
node.description: A 31-year-old woman is in police custody after a fire broke out at a Cairns quarantine hotel early on Sunday morning, forcing the evacuation of more than 160 people.

node.title: Uber Survived the Spying Scandal. Their Careers Didn’t.
node.description: A former co-worker accused the men of wiretapping their colleagues, hacking foreign governments and stealing trade secrets. It wasn’t true, but the allegations still follow them.

node.title: As U.K. Beckons Truck Drivers, Many in Poland Say ‘No Thanks’
node.description: A special visa offer, aimed at forestalling a supply chain fiasco during the holidays, goes begging for takers.

node.title: Israel to ban entry of foreigners from all countries over Omicron
node.description: Israel is the the first country to shut its borders completely as most major countries impose restrictions on travel from southern Africa, to try to contain the new Covid-19 variant called Omicron.

node.title: Which areas will the traffic light system apply to?
node.description: The government will soon decide what controls will apply in what areas under the new traffic light system, but it is still unclear if they will be applied to DHB boundaries, regions or territories.

node.title: 'It's devastating': Tearful Cairns mother learns she'll be sent to the Gold Coast after COVID hotel fire
node.description: Dozens of people evacuated after a hotel quarantine fire in Cairns say they've been told they'll be flown thousands of kilometres away to complete the rest of their isolation.

node.title: China study warns of 'colossal' COVID outbreak if it opens up, with daily cases forecast to exceed 630,000
node.description: A study by Peking University mathematicians shows China could not afford to lift travel restrictions without more efficient vaccinations or specific treatments.

node.title: Australia to introduce new laws to force media platforms to unmask online trolls
node.description: Australia will introduce legislation to make social media giants provide details of users who post defamatory comments, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said today.

node.title: 'Where are they going to put these families?' - Rest home plans worry residents
node.description: A group of elderly people in Porirua who thought they'd found a home to spend the rest of their lives in could be kicked out.

node.title: Travellers test positive to Omicron COVID-19 strain after arriving in Sydney from southern Africa
node.description: NSW Health confirms two returned travellers have tested positive for the new Omicron COVID-19 variant in Sydney.

node.title: Covid-19: 144 new community cases in NZ today, one further death
node.description: There have been 144 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, with one further death also reported.

node.title: Poor rating result of failure to fill mental health liaison role, DHB says
node.description: The MidCentral District Health Board has been unable to fill a critical role despite advertising nationally and internationally, it says.

node.title: NT records three more local COVID cases linked to Katherine cluster, as remote community enters lockdown
node.description: Three more local COVID-19 cases are recorded in the NT overnight, as the remote community of Lajamanu enters lockdown and testing continues of a South African traveller who may be carrying the new Omicron variant.

node.title: Nothing left: Expats remain in troubled Solomons as clean-up begins
node.description: With no plans to evacuate their citizens from Honiara, the international community is closely monitoring the situation in the Solomon Islands following a week of political unrest.

node.title: Judith Collins: 20 years of the Crusher in Parliament
node.description: Colourful and controversial, with a killer eyebrow raise - she may be best known as "Crusher" but Judith Collins' nearly 20 years in politics cannot be summed up so succinctly. Audio

node.title: Highway south of Blenheim to close for five days
node.description: State Highway 1 south of Blenheim will close for five nights to allow for work to repair the road surface in the Weld Pass.

node.title: Seasonal farm worker dies after lightning strike on farm south of Darwin
node.description: A 34-year-old man has died overnight in hospital after being struck by lightning earlier last week, while working on a mango farm in Berry Springs.

node.title: Victoria deaths top 500 in latest Covid-19 outbreak
node.description: There are now more than 11,300 active cases of the virus in Victoria, as tighter border rules come into force to respond to the new Omicron variant.

node.title: Hauraki Plains on track for lowest rainfall since 1993
node.description: Water supply on the Hauraki Plains is under threat this summer due to three years of lower than average rainfall.

node.title: More than 450,000 Kiwis eligible for booster shots by year's end
node.description: Booster vaccinations will be available throughout Aotearoa from tomorrow although double vaccinations remain the priority.

node.title: Govt announces $100m support package for Cook Islands and Fiji
node.description: The government has announced a further $100 million to support the Cook Islands and Fiji's Covid-19 response and recovery.

node.title: Ahmaud Arbery's mother fulfills promise: "I will get justice"
node.description: Inside the trial against the three White men accused of killing a Black jogger, the final guilty verdicts, and a mother's pursuit of the truth of what happened to her son.

node.title: Defense attorney brings up Colonel Sanders in attempt to save his client
node.description: Kevin Gough, William "Roddie" Bryan's lawyer, raises eyebrows with an unusual comment.

node.title: News crew security guard dies after being shot during attempted robbery
node.description: Kevin Nishita was an armed guard for Star Protection Agency and provided security for television news crews who are often targeted by robbers for their equipment.

node.title: No new cases of COVID-19 in SA as new rules for interstate travellers begin
node.description: South Australia records no new cases of COVID-19 today as tightened border rules come into effect, less than a week after opening up to vaccinated travellers.

node.title: Anti-troll laws could force social media companies to give out names and contact details
node.description: In an attempt to crack down on trolls, the federal government proposes new social media laws that could force companies to reveal names of anonymous users.

node.title: Kevin McCarthy's Statement on Lauren Boebert Doesn't Condemn Her Remarks
node.description: "Saying I am a suicide bomber is no laughing matter.... Normalizing this bigotry not only endangers my life but the lives of all Muslims," Rep. Ilhan Omar said.

node.title: Woman in police custody after blaze guts rooms at Cairns quarantine hotel
node.description: A 31-year-old woman is being questioned by police after fire breaks out in a Cairns quarantine hotel, destroying two rooms and forcing the evacuation of more than 160 people.

node.title: Swiss to vote on easing restrictions as cases surge
node.description: Switzerland has one of the lowest vaccination rates in Western Europe and Covid-19 infections are rising exponentially, yet voters are being asked whether the country should drop some restrictions…

node.title: What we know so far about the Omicron variant
node.description: Explainer - The World Health Organisation has declared a new coronavirus variant to be "of concern" and named it Omicron. Here's what we know so far. Audio

node.title: Boil water notice after heavy rain in Timaru
node.description: About 2500 Timaru households are on a boil water notice following heavy rain in the region.

node.title: Hawke's Bay Covid-19 case confirmed after routine swab at hospital
node.description: A Covid-19 case has been confirmed in Hawke's Bay after the person visited Hawke's Bay hospital.

node.title: Police appeal for sightings of missing Kapiti Coast man
node.description: Police are appealing to the public for sightings of a 63-year-old Kapiti Coast man who has been missing since Friday morning.

node.title: Residents told to say indoors as fire engulfs linen factory in Perth's east
node.description: Residents living near a factory fire in Perth's east are advised to stay indoors to avoid plumes of smoke and fumes filling the sky.

node.title: Some businesses start to reopen in Solomon Islands as Morrison says more support being sent from Australia
node.description: The Prime Minister says Australian military and federal police personnel are in the Solomon Islands "to provide a stable and safe environment" as tensions begin to ease after days of rioting and looting that left three people dead.

node.title: Israel to ban entry of foreigners from every country over Omicron variant
node.description: Israel will ban the entry of all foreigners into the country, making it the first country to shut its borders completely in response to a new and potentially more contagious coronavirus variant.

node.title: NT records three new cases of COVID linked to Katherine cluster
node.description: Three more local COVID-19 cases are recorded in the NT overnight, bringing the total number of cases linked to the Katherine cluster to 56.

node.title: Julie Ann Genter cycles to hospital to give birth
node.description: Green Party MP Julie Ann Genter has given birth to a baby girl, after cycling to hospital while in labour overnight.

node.title: Stephen Sondheim, Titan of the American Musical, Is Dead at 91
node.description: He was the theater’s most revered and influential composer-lyricist of the last half of the 20th century and the driving force behind some of Broadway’s most beloved and celebrated shows.

node.title: ‘Elemental and Irreplaceable’: Stars Pay Tribute to Stephen Sondheim
node.description: Audra McDonald, Bernadette Peters, Andrew Lloyd Webber and others mourned and celebrated the essential composer and lyricist, who died at 91.

node.title: How did Omicron get its name?
node.description: By Vimal Patel

node.title: A COVID-hit Portuguese football team could only field nine players. They conceded seven goals in a half
node.description: Portuguese team Belenenses is only able to field a team of nine players — including two goalkeepers — due to a COVID outbreak, and finds itself 7-0 down against Benfica before the match is abandoned.

node.title: How much would it cost to reforest Australian farmland for carbon credits?
node.description: Offsetting agricultural emissions through reforestation would cost a fair chunk of farm profits, new research suggests. So what's the best way to tackle agricultural emissions?

node.title: Black Caps fight back in first test
node.description: Tim Southee has claimed a five wicket bag as the Black Caps fight back in the first Test against India.

node.title: Covid-19: Australia joins ban to Africa travellers after Omicron variant discovery
node.description: Australia has joined the United States and Europe in restricting travel from Africa over the new Omicron Covid-19 variant.

node.title: Nanaia Mahuta discusses international relations with US Secretary of State
node.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Nanaia Mahuta has met with the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on the final stage of a 17-day world trip.

node.title: Firefighters and three helicopters battle Woodhill Forest fire
node.description: Firefighters have contained a forest fire north of Auckland which broke out last night.

node.title: New York Islanders games postponed amid COVID-19 outbreak
node.description: Eight players on the team are currently under the NHL's COVID-19 protocol.

node.title: Omicron variant upends global pandemic response.
node.description: Britain, Israel and others implemented new security measures as some health experts urged caution.

node.title: Laszlo Z. Bito, Scientist, Novelist and Philanthropist, Dies at 87
node.description: He fled communist rule in Hungary, discovered a treatment for glaucoma in the U.S., then became an author and a voice against authoritarianism in his homeland.

node.title: 7 Mysteries About the Universe That Have Baffled Scientists
node.description: Scientists are currently unable to explain these mysteries, but are working hard to unravel them.

node.title: Antony Blinken Calls Omicron Discovery, Transparency by South Africa 'Model for the World'
node.description: Blinken pointed that the South African government's transparency in sharing news about Omicron "should serve as a model for the world."

node.title: Anthony Fauci Says COVID-19 Omicron Variant Could Already Be in U.S.
node.description: "The vaccines we have may well be able to contain this." However, he believes the new variant may also "go essentially all over" the world," Fauci said.

node.title: Siege ends after masked gunman taken into custody on NSW south coast
node.description: A siege situation is resolved in a NSW south coast town near the Illawarra, after a masked man was seen firing shots outside a store.

node.title: Genomic testing for Omicron underway after COVID-positive passengers from southern Africa touch down in Sydney
node.description: Urgent genomic testing is underway to determine if infected passengers who arrived in Sydney from southern Africa are carrying the Omicron COVID-19 variant.

node.title: Police seek help after aggravated burglary in Bluff
node.description: An aggravated burglary in Bluff on Friday has left one man in Southland Hospital with moderate injuries. Police are now appealing for help from the public to identify those responsible.

node.title: Wakefield Poole, Pioneer in Gay Pornography, Dies at 85
node.description: He gave up a dance career to create a crossover, and now classic, hit film in 1971 that had both gay and straight audiences, and celebrities, lining up to see it.

node.title: Focus on Politics: Collins, National's nuclear option, self destructs
node.description: Podcast - This week, Deputy Political Editor Craig McCulloch recounts the nuclear destruction of Judith Collins' leadership and assesses the fallout. Audio

node.title: Iwi-led housing project in Napier to be fast-tracked
node.description: Environment Minister David Parker is allowing an iwi-led housing development in Napier to fast-track its consent processes.

node.title: NZ could buy carbon reduction credits more cheaply than domestic action - study
node.description: A new study indicates new international carbon markets will allow countries to co-operate and make deep and comparatively cheap global climate gas reductions.

node.title: Families of Erebus victims concerned and upset by protests over memorial
node.description: A man who lost his mother in the crash on Mount Erebus says protests of the proposed memorial are deeply upsetting and tarnish the occasion.

node.title: Trump Would've Already Made a Vaccine for Omicron Variant, Stephen Miller Claims
node.description: It took the Trump Administration 11 months to develop its first COVID-19 vaccine after the first confirmed coronavirus case emerged in the United States.

node.title: Victoria has recorded 1,061 new local COVID cases and four deaths
node.description: There are now 11,331 active cases of the virus in Victoria, as tighter border rules come into force to respond to the new Omicron variant.

node.title: Week in Politics: What was Judith Collins really thinking?
node.description: Analysis - Judith Collins loses the National Party leadership after disciplining Simon Bridges, the prime minister sets 3 December as "freedom day" and there's a mixed reaction to plans for re-opening…

node.title: 'I know God is here' - Church takes vaccination to congregation
node.description: A church that has been considered anti-vax is hosting a vaccination event to encourage remaining unvaccinated members to get their first dose - and reframe anti-vax perceptions of the church.

node.title: New Zealand bans travel from 9 southern African countries
node.description: New Zealand is banning travel from nine southern African countries from tomorrow night in an effort to curb the potential spread of the new Omicron coronavirus variant.

node.title: Police boost presence in Tasman district
node.description: Police are boosting their presence in the Tasman district, in a bid to curb overt gang activity in the area.

node.title: Almost 6000 switch benefits after welfare policy change
node.description: The subsequent child policy benefit sanction was scrapped earlier this month.

node.title: N.F.L. to Settle Lawsuit Over Rams’ Relocation for $790 Million
node.description: Rams owner Stanley Kroenke is expected to pay the entire amount, ending the four-year court battle over the team’s move to Los Angeles in 2016.

node.title: Gunman Opens Fire Aboard Bus in Michigan, Hitting Passengers After Thanksgiving Holiday
node.description: Kalamazoo police responded to the "active shooter situation" at a bus station Saturday morning.

node.title: Black Friday Mall Shooting Sees Child Hit by Bullet Ricochet, Man in Critical Condition
node.description: Three people were shot during the incident while three other people sustained non-life-threatening injuries that weren't gunshot-related, police said.

node.title: Court Temporarily Blocks Enforcement of Vaccine Mandate for California Prison Workers
node.description: The vaccine mandate would have taken effect January 12, but the stay pauses its enforcement until an appeals hearing that is scheduled for March.

node.title: Florida Woman Charged for Giving Naked Lap Dances to Senior Citizens
node.description: She allegedly sat naked upon the laps of two of the home's other residents and told one of them, "You like it."

node.title: Pro-Trump Lawyer Lin Wood Rips 'Not Very Smart' Mike Flynn, Claims They're at 'War'
node.description: Wood accused Flynn and attorney Sidney Powell of being "grifters" and part of a "deep state" conspiracy.

node.title: Bobby is extremely proud of his 'stunning' coffee van — and his family feel the same about him
node.description: Bobby Pate calls himself a people person and everywhere he goes he loves to spread happiness. Now with the help of his family he'll be offering coffee and a smile in his "stunning" kombi barista van.

node.title: Security forces fire tear gas, arrest doens of protesters in Burkina Faso
node.description: Protesters are angry at the government's inability to stem violence linked to Al Qaeda and the Islamic State group.

node.title: 'Young people are written off too quickly': These candidates say it's time for change
node.description: People under 30 are the most under-represented in New South Wales local government, but young candidates running in the December 4 election are determined to address that.

node.title: Meet the family building a desert dynasty in the Red Centre
node.description: Angus and Kimberley McKay are quietly building a cattle empire in the desert, making bold purchases and adopting a prudent cattle management plan to look after their land.

node.title: James sought a CT scan to explain his constant headaches. What they found had 'a bunch of people panicking'
node.description: James Enaver says the first signs that he was ill were the persistent headaches that started three years ago. Now, a fundraising effort by friends and family has led to Tasmania's first tumour biobank.
